EducationDetails.Text:
VISUAL COMMUNICATIONS DEGREE
BROOKHAVEN COMMUNITY COLLEGE
SR ART DIRECTOR GRAPHIC DESIGNER
Accomplished graphic design expert with artistic talent that produces quality marketing,


print, digital, and social media content and products.

Proven track record of conceptualizing, designing, and developing wide range of revenue-generating visuals. Adept at understanding what client and customers are looking for and translating those requirements into content that match or surpass expectations.
Capable of producing materials unassisted as well as collaborating with others to complete
projects while following explicit parameters and instructions. Dedicate and detail-oriented
professional consistently delivery premium, progressive, and unique content.


•   Graphic Design
AREAS OF EMPHASIS
• Creative Direction
•   Full Life Cycle Project Management	• Web Usability Best Practices / UX
•   Website Development	• Corporate Branding
•   Advertising and Marketing Strategy	• Concept Development
•   Logo Design	 • Relationship Development

ExperienceSummary.Description: The candidate is experienced in the management of:  Sales; and Marketing (Digital; Marketing Communications). The candidate has 16 years of work experience, with 14 years of management experience, including a mid-level position.
ExperienceSummary.ManagementStory:
Starting on 1/1/2005, the candidate held the following mid-level management position for 14 years and 3 months:
	Title: Senior Art Director for Blockparty
ExperienceSummary.AttentionNeeded: ATTENTION: The candidate appears to have been in management in a past role (Senior Art Director for Blockparty), but was not in management in the most recent role as Senior Packaging Designer for We Are Alexander.

Positions.Description:
Successfully develop profitable logos, packaging designs, and other materials, that reflects and maintains the overall company image.
Envision and design original packaging that is functional and will attract customers. Produce
and execute seasonal packaging concepts. Coordinate and partner with clients and marketing teams to generate packaging that aligns with a company's brand and identity.
Develop cost-effective prototypes for customers, offering a first look at the finished product.

SELECTED ACHIEVEMENTS:
• Provided designs for logos, point-of-purchase (POP), point-of-sales (POS), signs, murals,

and various other materials.

Positions.JobLevel: Senior Manager (more than 5 years management experience)
Positions.Description:
Dallas, Texas | Smithaus - Dallas, Texas | AdvoCare International - Plano, Texas |
Razor - Addison, Texas | Concussion, LLP, - Fort Worth Texas

Senior Art Director, 1/2005 to 1/2019
In consecutive roles, designed and developed visual styles and images used for promotional

items, advertising materials, and various merchandise, products and visual design comps.
Created graphic design content for social media platforms, digital media, and print.
Produced high quality work independently and delivered premium content as a team

member for numerous projects requiring graphic design expertise. Monitored graphic design
trends, mastering new methods, techniques, and programs, utilizing newly acquired skills to efficiently and effectively create original content.

SELECTED ACHIEVEMENTS:
• Developed logos that were used a high-profile college football games and tailgates, motion
graphics for stadium boards and monitors, and festival graphics, while working at Blockparty
• Through producing first-rate content at Blockparty, list of clients grew to include some of

the top colleges and universities in the nation.
• Managed all visual content for AdvoCare's NASCAR Program and partnered with Roush
Fenway Racing, a well-known and respected racing organization.
• Led all rebranding efforts concerning the company's number 1 selling product, continuing
to grow products sales.
• Acquired clients such as Baskin-Robbins, Cheesecake Factory and Rent-A-Center while in role at Razor.
• Revamp the logo for the largest American barbeque franchise, Dickie's Barbecue, and also produced work for Dean Foods, Hershey's Milk, and other large companies and businesses,
while working at Concussion, LLP.

Findings.Message: We detected that this document contained at least some data that was laid out as columns or tables. We rearranged that data to make it more usable. NEVER use columns or tables in a resume.
You should not use the PDF format for your resume. Due to inherent limitations with text extraction from PDFs, you are less likely to get a job when using a PDF resume.
A first and last name was not found in the contact information. A resume should always include the candidate's first and last name.

The following section was identified as a skills section type: 'SKILLS'. Skills should not be in a separate section, but instead, each skill should be included in the descriptions of work history or education. THIS IS INCREDIBLY IMPORTANT FOR AI MATCHING ALGORITHMS
